title: Collective Intelligence
description: Collective intelligence is the study of how individuals coordinate, collaborate, and deliberate to produce outcomes greater than any single agent can do alone. In this course, students will explore different crowdsourcing platforms and mechanisms, read and discuss foundational papers in the field, meet virtually with contemporary authors, and write a novel research proposal that could lead to publication. Recommended preparation: COGS 230 is recommended, but not required. Prerequisites: graduate standing.
